III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) This facility is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services, therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) This facility is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services, therefore, MDHHS Policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not in need of any technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
- The facility reported an increase in number of restraints. There was a report that
10 of 16 restraints involved one youth. The facility reported the youth has mental
health needs and has been on the waiting list for admission at a mental health
inpatient hospital. This consultant provided the assistance to continue to work
towards using verbal de-escalation skills and communication with youth’s case
worker to help get the youth into the correct programing.
- During the interviews with the youth, it was noted the youth would like to
encourage the facility to work on their intake process as it pertains to LGBTQ
community. This consultant spoke with the facility about looking at their intake
process and incorporating asking about gender identity and preferred pronouns.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility had three special investigations during this period under review and none
of those resulted in a corrective action plan. The facility has submitted one
acceptable corrective action plan not related to maltreatment during this licensing
period in response to the 2021 Interim Inspection. The facility has implemented a
plan where the supervisors and director will review all youth reports and make sure
all appropriate signatures are obtained timely. The facility has also implemented plan
to make sure all youth have timely medical screens when admitted into the
programs. The director has been tracking this corrective action plan and has been
successful with full implementation. No repeat violations were found during this
renewal audit.
An onsite tour was completed on 10/06/2022. The facility was observed to be clean
and well maintained. Ample staff were present and observed to be supervising the
residents. The consultant viewed all the rooms the youth are living, it was observed
to be clean and well maintained. Residents were attending their onsite schooling
4

during the tour, and some were observed to be play ping pong during a break with
staff.
During staff interviews staff reported feeling both staff and youth are safe at the
facility and supervision is provided as required. Staff are given ample training
opportunities and feel supported by management. Youth indicated they participate in
a variety of recreational and education actives included life skill building. Youth
reported feeling safe at the facility. Both staff and youth interviewed stated youth are
rarely restrained and typically staff just use verbal de-escalation skills to calm the
youth down. A youth interviewed did provide the feedback that one thing they would
change would be the intake process. The youth reported they would like to see more
LGBTQ inclusivity by having the intake person ask the youth their preferred gender
and pronouns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
